Half-Life but you play as B. Calhoun, a security officer in Black Mesa. Compared to Half-Life and Half-Life opposition force this game is quite shorter and much more easier mainly due to how much resources you can get after getting into a battle, unlike the Half-Life and Opposition Forces which were quite unforgiving with their resources. More than 3/4th's of my fight in HL and HL:OF forced me to fight with less than 10 hp left, while in HL:BS I almost always had 100 hp and even a bit of armor when getting into fight, hell I only ever died in my playthrough due to the environment such as falling to my death, never died during combat. So if you like Half-Life but want the campaign to be shorter and be easier then this game is right up your alley.

It's not that I wouldn't recommend the game, but Steam reviews don't give you many rating options. I just don't think it deserves the same rating as the original or Opposing Force given the horrible amount of bugs and rather bland gameplay.

This game has about 3 hours of gameplay. It took both me and my boyfriend 3 and half hours to finish it, and if we both didn't get stuck searching for a ladder in the underground, I think it would be almost exactly 3 hours.

I experienced this really annoying bug where every time I reloaded the game, the guy started shooting. No matter what save it was, if I reloaded it myself or I died. There were like ten different places I got stuck ‚Äì jumping or crouching didn't help, and I had to reload the game.

Gameplay-wise, I really struggled at the beginning because of the lack of ammo. There was a segment where I had to rush a corridor full of aliens because I simply didn't have any ammo. But once you met the soldiers, you earned a ton of it and the game became super easy.

Story wise, I enjoyed the beginning because I really like seeing one situation from different angles. But then it got kinda boring. Let's just say I expected a bit more, because it looked very promising at first. There was a point where the scientist said "you gotta retrieve a power cell", and I thought "this feels like there will be another chapter, but I doubt they would make a chapter based on retrieving a power cell", and then the title "Power Struggle'' appears. So yeah, the story is so-so.

Oh and I hated the part in the already mentioned Power Struggle where you have to connect a cut detonator by a barrel. I thought about it but then didn't say it out loud because I thought my bf would think I am an idiot for even thinking that it could work. Well that's exactly what you are supposed to do and it just doesn't make much sense to me.

as for blue shift being a 2 hour long campaign i don't think it's that bad honestly, well some people may criticize it for how short it is, but to be fair it's not all that bad, just a sweet and simple half-life game. in this one you play as Barney Calhoun, a security guard working at black mesa up until shit hits the fan just like in HL1, soon after Calhoun attempts to escape black mesa but not without the help of Dr. Rosenberg and some scientists of his who built a transporter to teleport themselves outside the facility. if you're looking to kill 2 hours of your time, give blue shift a whirl

I must say right away that this dlc to half kat is worse than the Opposing Force dlc. This DLC didn't add any new weapons, enemies or mechanics. And the duration of the DLC is also short. But this part is important for the Half Life universe, because this part tells the story of Barney Calhoun, who will appear in Half Life 2.
For me, this game is not bad, but compared to Opposing Force, this part is weaker and worse.

dis be good

I am a 40 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Si bien no es mi expansi√≥n favorita no la considero mala mediocre capaz. 
Historia:"eres Barney Calhoun un guardia de seguridad que vive el incidente de black mesa tu objetivo es escapar con vida"
siguiendo la misma premisa solo que en esta ocasi√≥n no somos un cient√≠fico/a o un marine. Suena interesante la premisa sin embargo es solo eso sobrevivir y escapar lo √∫nico que agrego fue a Barney y al Rosenberg (aunque este no vuelve a aparecer)
Contenido:contamos con casi todas las armas del primer HL (excepto el ca√±√≥n tau hivehand gluon gun) no agrega nuevas armas tampoco hay nuevos enemigos saliendo en su mayor√≠a vortigaunt, marines, headcrab, zombies  uno que otro houndeye y bullsquid esto lo hace bastante decepcionante y aburrido.
Conclusi√≥n: no es una buena expansi√≥n pero tampoco es mala agrego a un nuevo protagonista (que a diferencia de los otros volvi√≥ en la secuela)lo recomiendo si quieres volver a ver el incidente de black mesa desde otro punto de vista
